name: Athole Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal place to stay for visiting Bath, we had a car and were able to just leave it both on the day and when leaving which was very convenient. Our room was lovely overlooking the front garden the back garden was always very well maintained and pretty. It was very welcoming and plenty of help and advice on what to do in the local area. We were able to come and go as pleased, which was lovely. The breakfast was plentiful, loads of choice both food and beverages. Would definetly go back again in summer.
reviews.title: Lovely midweek break to Bath

reviews.text: It was a last minute booking and we were lucky to get the largest room! The lovely couple Wolfgang and Josephine were lovely. They make you feel extremely comfortable. The room had all the modern amenities and is larger than my friend's bedroom in London. The English breakfast was delicious and more choices then I expected.
reviews.title: I met the Happy Buddha!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Athole House is close to the city and they provided many recommendations for restaurants.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pickup and delivery of our bags to the train station was a big plus. We did not have to carry our bags around when we enjoyed the last morning in Bath. Thank you 'Happy Buddha', for a wonderful trip!
reviews.title: Definitely worth the 5 star reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately for us this was only a one night stay but what a treat. Wonderful hosts, lovely house, great room and a wonderful breakfast.
reviews.title: Still the best place to stay in Bath!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Attention to detail and going the extra mile made this b and b stay far more than a bed for a few nights - it made it an extremely pleasant experience in itself! The hosts Wolfgang and Josephine were warm, welcoming and extremely attentive. The room was bright airy and well decorated and the bed extremely comfortable . The breakfast featured 5 or 6 of Wolfgangs delicious home made breads ( baked daily) and Josephines very morish homemade marmalade , yoghourt and the star of the show - blueberry pancakes smothered in maple syrup! The full english was also extremely good and used lovely sausages and lean good quality bacon.
reviews.title: First Class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a b and b experience unlike any we have experienced before!
reviews.title: If only we'd discovered the Athole sooner!

reviews.text: We had just the one night at the Athole and arrived around 11am on the first day. We were immediately made to feel very welcome indeed, being able to leave the car in the car park whilst we walked into the centre of Bath was a real bonus. The room was lovely, and the chocolate mints on the pillows was a lovely touch :)
reviews.title: Just Great!

reviews.text: Breakfast was, quite simply, amazing. We opted for the full English and had to be rolled out of the lovely conservatory that serves as the dining room. It was gorgeous!
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

reviews.text: Wolfgang assured us that leaving the car on our 2nd day, despite already checking out, was not a problem so we were able to mooch around Bath a little longer before heading home.
reviews.title: That's what I call a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Athole House for one night while we visited Bath. The B&B is clean, convenient and the rooms are comfortable. We arrived in the evening and were greeted by Wolfgang. He not only helped us with our heavy bags up the stairs to our room but also provided excellent information about the city, sights and where we could get a good meal (we were tired and hungry so this was more than appreciated. We were also able to keep our car (free of charge by their garage on the property for the night and half the day after we checked out to see the town).
reviews.title: Don't need much more from a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Pope and found the wonderfully modern, updated bathroom lovely along with the spacious, comfortably furnished room.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: In the morning we enjoyed one of the best B&B breakfast ever, everything freshly prepared. The variety of food options was a treat - the B&B even has a homemade yogurt to choose from among all the others. We had a full English breakfast, a Lox omelette and oatmeal, delicious tea and juice.
reviews.title: Amazing !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Josephine and Wolfgang are both very friendly and chatting with them was very nice. If you plan to visit Bath this is place is a great choice.
reviews.title: Lovely, quiet stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a birthday treat the warm welcome we were given was just the begining of a wonderful stay.The room was large and clean with a good size shower room ensuite.Braekfast was excellent pancakes to die for full english sets you up for the day.Thank you Wolfgang for letting ys leave the car for the day so we could walk around Bath. We will be back
reviews.title: Athole Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room, host,and freshly cooked breakfast-our stay was great in every respect. It was just before Christmas and Bath was very busy but this hotel provided peace and comfort. We can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: How perfect can you get?

reviews.text: It wasn't until this lovely place made recent news, that I realised it was where my daughter and I
reviews.title: Athole Guest House. Bath. An absolute must.
Wonderful
reviews.text: stayed when last in Bath for my bridesmaids 10th Anniversary party. What a super find, we

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: picked it merely by chance and have now planned to go back for a 4-day break. EVERYTHING,
reviews.title: Mum and Dads birthday treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and I really do mean EVERYTHING was just perfect - but especially the yummy breakfasts.
reviews.title: So relaxed at Athole House ...

description: With its 5 stars and Gold Award, Athole House is the antidote to chintz and dusty four posters. Instead, it is a large Victorian home restored to give bright, inviting bedrooms with flat screen TV, free WIFI, phone, room safe and fridge, sleek furniture, sparkling en suite bathrooms with high-pressure showers, and an award-winning breakfast. 12 minutes' walk from centre in quiet location. Free parking in grounds. Free transfer from/to station.
